title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 890.82 - Safeguard public interest
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 890.82 - Safeguard public interest

State Regulations

Review and consideration of any project affecting
wetlands conducted pursuant to this policy shall include balanced assessment of
the environmental and economic impact of the project. Encroachment on wetlands
shall not be permitted unless such assessment shall establish that no feasible
alternative exists and that overriding public interest has been demonstrated. Project encroachments having no alternatives and demonstrating an overriding
public interest shall be planned, constructed and operated in a manner to
safeguard the present and future public interest in the environmental values
derived from such areas. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
890.82

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
